str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.

str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.

A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
Pilate. Of Latin origin; close-pressed, i.e. Firm; Pilatus, a Roman.

str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

str2: To put to death, kill; fig: I abolish. From apo and kteino; to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy.

Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
